refnamediv.refpurpose: Establish a connection to database server in non-blocking mode

refentry.refsect1:
&reftitle.description;
int mysql_real_connect_start
MYSQL ** ret
MYSQL * mysql_real_connect
MYSQL * mysql
const char * host
const char * user
const char * passwd
const char * db
unsigned int port
const char * unix_socket
unsigned long flags
Initiates a non-blocking connection request to a server.

&reftitle.parameters;
ret
When &function.mysql_real_connect_start; or &function.mysql_real_connect_cont; returns zero, a copy of the passed 'mysql' argument is stored in *ret.
mysql
A mysql handle, which was previously initialized or allocated by &function.mysql_init;
host
Can be either a host name or an IP address. Passing the NULL value or the string "localhost" to this parameter, the local host is assumed.
user
The user name
passwd
If provided or NULL, the server will attempt to authenticate the user against those user records which have no password only. This allows one username to be used with different permissions (depending on if a password as provided or not).
db
If provided will specify the default database to be used when performing queries.
port
Specifies the port number to attempt to connect to the server.
unix_socket
Specifies the socket or named pipe that should be used.
flags
The flags allows to set various connection options

&reftitle.notes;
If &function.mysql_real_connect_start; returns zero, then the operation completed without blocking.
